about.title: Our Mission
about.description: Happy Paws Dog Rescue was founded in 2015 with a simple but powerful mission: every dog deserves a loving home. We rescue dogs from high-kill shelters, provide necessary medical care and rehabilitation, and work tirelessly to match them with perfect families. Our comprehensive approach includes behavioral training, medical care, and ongoing support to ensure successful adoptions.

story.title: Our Story
story.content: Happy Paws Dog Rescue was founded in 2015 by a group of passionate dog lovers who saw the overwhelming need for dog rescue in our community. What started as a small group of volunteers has grown into a comprehensive rescue organization that has saved over 1,200 dogs. We work with local shelters, take in owner surrenders, and rescue dogs from difficult situations, providing them with medical care, training, and love until they find their perfect forever homes.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.content: To rescue, rehabilitate, and rehome dogs in need while educating our community about responsible pet ownership, the importance of spay/neuter programs, and the incredible bond between humans and dogs. We believe every dog deserves a second chance and a loving home.

members.name: Jennifer Martinez
members.title: Executive Director & Founder
members.bio: Jennifer founded Happy Paws after volunteering at local shelters for 10 years. She oversees all rescue operations and has personally helped place over 500 dogs in loving homes.

members.name: Dr. Robert Kim
members.title: Veterinary Director
members.bio: Dr. Kim provides medical care for all our rescue dogs. With 15 years of veterinary experience, he ensures every dog receives the best possible health care before adoption.

members.name: Lisa Thompson
members.title: Volunteer Coordinator
members.bio: Lisa manages our amazing team of 50+ volunteers. She coordinates foster families, adoption events, and ensures our dogs get the socialization and care they need.

adoption.title: Adoption Application
adoption.description: Ready to welcome a new family member? Our adoption process ensures the perfect match between you and your future dog.
adoption.requirements: Must be 21 years or older, valid ID, proof of residence, landlord approval if renting, veterinary references if you've had pets
adoption.process: Submit online application, application review (24-48 hours), meet and greet with your chosen dog, home visit if required, finalize adoption
adoption.fees: Adoption fees range from $150-$400 and include spay/neuter, vaccinations, microchip, and health check

foster.title: Foster Application
foster.description: Foster families provide temporary care for dogs who need extra time before adoption. We provide all supplies and medical care.
foster.requirements: Must be 18 years or older, stable living situation, time to dedicate to foster care, transportation to vet appointments
foster.types: Puppy foster, medical foster, behavioral foster, maternity foster, respite foster
foster.support: All food and supplies provided, complete medical care, 24/7 support hotline, training and guidance

volunteer.title: Volunteer Application
volunteer.description: Volunteers are the heart of our organization. Whether you have an hour a week or several hours a day, there are meaningful ways to contribute.
volunteer.requirements: Must be 16 years or older (some positions 18+), reliable and committed, comfortable around dogs, able to follow safety protocols
volunteer.opportunities: Dog care and socialization, dog walking, administrative work, events and fundraising, transportation, photography, social media
volunteer.commitment: Minimum commitment of 6 months and at least 2 hours per week for consistency
